she remembered her name yes you did Welcome to Maxwell's I'm Jeff Milligan the manager here I've got the kind of place that people talking about that people want to try it's a place folks return to again and again it's the kind of place I've always dreamed of how did we get here a very big part of it is promotion my goals for Maxwell's are probably a lot like yours attract new customers keep existing ones loyal keep the place filled make bigger profits to

those goals you have to constantly promote your operation if you're anything like me you may not have a marketing department to carry out your promotions so think of marketing not as a department but as a way of doing business the way I see it Maxwell's has a 25-member marketing team made up of every member of the staff and all of our employees are involved in the three-step process we use for managing successful promotions the first step is planning where we gather information

set objectives and come up with promotional strategies then comes execution where we set the plan into motion getting the word out and delivering everything our promotions promised we would then evaluation and I'm going process where we give our promotions a long hard look to see what's working and what isn't right now we're enjoying the benefits of a promotion that began around eight weeks ago like every successful promotion it began with careful planning

the first step in planning is to Define where you're starting from so I sat down with my assistant manager Carolyn and our Chef Lorraine to analyze our situation everything from hours of operation to number of seats to average guest check most of the information we needed was in house it was just a matter of bringing it all together in analyzing it any major changes in sales trans not really Mondays and Tuesdays are still wait and there's our four to six pm weekday slump the

Play Still hops all weekend analyzing our sales and products helped us identify strengths so we could capitalize on them and isolate weaknesses so we can correct them what about special requests are we seeing any Trends there about a few things are happening we know that our most popular items are the lighter entrees teriyaki chicken breasts stir fry dishes that's been happening for a while but people are starting to get real specific about preparation you know they want their fish broiled dry or their meal prepared without

not have they want to know what's in it yeah people are getting more and more diet conscious that's right and it's not just people who are watching their weight it's an overall interest in their health The Next Step was to gather information on what I call the three C's the community the competition and the customers I wanted to get others involved in compile the data quickly so I asked Carolyn and Chef to recommend a few key employees to help gather this information Alex and Sarah Alex is studying marketing at Cranbrook

nature where the big Employers in town maybe any new businesses opening up I see what you're getting at we also need to find out what's coming up in town in terms of major activities and special events the community profile helps you see the true potential of your trading area with the right promotions any place where people congregate can be a source of increased business for your restaurant you can collect information from the Chamber of Commerce your Public Library

planning successful promotions is a lot like putting together a puzzle what you're looking for the pieces that fit together just right in the strategies you select or limited only by your imagination and by your budget be sure to budget enough money to finance your promotions there are no rules about what to spend here at Maxwell's we spend about five percent that's an expenditure based on the return We budgeted when we set our objectives are measurable goals for the
think of promotions isn't investment if you plan well set realistic objectives and involve your people your promotions will pay off in dollars and in Goodwill

so often when you walk into a facility and you go to this cafeteria the day after day you want something different and it's it's our objective to make sure that there is something different and I think we've become pretty successful with that

oh that smells incredible do you mind if I just have a little taste once you've selected your promotional strategies you'll need to communicate your message get people interested in what you're offering there are all kinds of ways to do that here at Maxwell's we used a mix of free publicity paid advertising and promotional activities here's what I mean by free publicity to launch her new light menu our Chef made an appearance on good day Quad Cities I guess

our Lorry Hutchins the chef at Maxwell's here in town and Annabeth Webster had dietitian at Harper Hospital's new cardiovascular research institute now from what I understand you're two organizations have kind of joined forces to launch a new heart smart menu at Maxwell's right that's right in addition to our traditional menu we've taken our five favorite entrees and made them Hearts park for those who are watching fat and cholesterol super idea that with the right message the right medium and a good angle you can get a
a lot of good free publicity

no paid advertising is another tool once you've researched your local media and set a budget it could pay to buy advertising time or space but you should concentrate most of your time and budget on a few carefully selected inexpensive promotional activities

you can choose from internal promotions such as frequency devices special events discount and external promotions like Direct Mail giveaways and cross promotions with other establishments the key here is to choose what's right for your establishment your community and your customers before you start pulling customers in with your promotions be sure you're ready communicate with your staff be sure they are sold on your promotions

he sure they're trained in how to implement them seek their input and keep them motivated with plenty of recognition and your own enthusiasm now keeping in mind that we want to focus on the process let's take a look at some of the choices we made here at Maxwell's

here's what we did with internal and external promotions internal promotions focus on our current customers the ones we're already here for our big promotional emphasis we decided to focus on the lighter healthier menu in house we develop table tents with a heart-smart message and a Maxwell's summer Lights theme we created special menu inserts complete with nutritional information about all of our heart smart entrees calories fat sodium that type of thing

we even had server badges made by a local specialty advertising company to encourage repeat business and to attract more traffic on those slow weeknights we offer discount coupons to lunch customers good for two dollars off any dinner entree

and we started to reward frequent diners with VIP Punch Cards by 10 dinners get one free a lot of our promotions are done by bundling items together for example if you purchase an entree you receive an 38 ounce fountain soda those types of things we've developed a program where the manager and the waitress will meet the regular customers learn their name

and put their mug up on a rack with her name on it the customers each time they come in the restaurant and are free to go up there and use our mug every time I come in it's a very fun effective system we've developed for bring people back external promotions are designed to attract new customers to fill the place during that four to six pm slump we implemented an early-bird dinner with special discounts on light entrees we sent a direct mail piece to all the senior citizens living in the new golf you retire

I meant community and to other local retirement communities that's all it took we invited them and they came got some good news for you employees can be great marketing resources to here at Maxwell's they earn points for bringing in new customers redeemable for a gift of their choice congratulations hey six new customers last month we certainly appreciate it here those concert tickets the important thing is to tie employee incentives to something employees value and be sure they get

reward right away be sure you talk to people who talk to people cab drivers hairdressers bartenders lots of folks can help you promote your restaurant yeah heard of Maxwell's but never actually been inside well you should try us out why don't you come for dinner some night as my guest sure here are two complimentary meal passes hey thanks thanks a lot you're welcome we followed through on the cross promotion idea with Body Works

as the name implies cross-promotions work both ways that's why they succeed we printed up discount coupons exclusively for Body Works members with both logos on it they printed up free passes for Maxwell's customers only we appreciate your doing this these look great too will start Distributing these on Friday Hey listen I've got a couple of free dinner passes for you for you and a guest hey thank you you know that's about ready to ask you to try our club as my guest great I definitely
they will

we've set up two programs with the local police department one was a community-wide 25 program and through that the kids in school agreed to take drug tests and to prove that their drug free and with that they're issued a photo ID by the police department and we give them a ten percent discount when they come into our to our restaurant it's a very successful program brings business in Fosters a restaurant and also helps out the community which is what you need to do to be successful in this business

some promotions work and others don't the only way to know how well we did is to take an honest look at the objectives we set and how close we came to reaching them now that's a process that begins as soon as the promotion does look at the numbers every day are you meeting those objectives don't be afraid to change your approach even while the promotion is underway and when it's done you've got to evaluate it you owe it to yourself and to all the people who work so hard to pull it off

so be sure to ask the question how do we do here's how we did that for two 6:00 slump we increased volume by two percentage points more than we predicted and we're still going strong our frequent Diner punch card the Heart Smart menu and the cross-promotion with Body Works have all generated just about what we thought they would be boosted our sales and our image but not everything worked the lunch coupon program and never took off our lunch customers just don't come downtown for dinner
and when something fails it's important to figure out why it didn't work so we can modify avoid making the same mistakes in the future

the most expensive thing in your restaurant is an empty seat in this business you've got to do things a little better if you want to fill it plan your promotions by defining your situation setting objectives and coming up with strategies that address your problems and opportunities execute your promotions creatively and with enthusiasm using a mix of publicity advertising and promotional activities and evaluate your results so you and your staff can learn from the

and build upon it involve and motivate your employees they're the ones who will make your promotions pay off more than anything take care of your customers find out what they want and give it to them offer them more value let them know how important they are to you use your VIP card please come back soon you see I am a VIP at Maxwell that means a very important person
